{"step_by_step_thinking": "The umbilical cord is a conduit between the developing embryo or fetus and the placenta. It usually contains three vessels: two arteries and one vein. The vein supplies the fetus with oxygenated, nutrient-rich blood from the placenta. Conversely, the umbilical arteries return deoxygenated, nutrient-depleted blood from the fetus to the placenta.", "answer_choice": "D. 2 arteries & 1 vein"}
